element.definition: The ModuleMetadata structure defines the common metadata elements used by quality improvement artifacts. This information includes descriptive and topical metadata to enable repository searches, as well as governance and evidentiary support information.
element.short: Defines common metadata used by quality artifacts

element.definition: An absolute URL that is used to identify this module when it is referenced. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this module definition is (or will be) published.
element.requirements: Allows the module to be referenced by a single globally unique identifier.
element.short: Logical URL to reference this module

element.definition: A logical identifier for the module such as the CMS or NQF identifiers for a measure artifact.
element.requirements: Allows external business identifiers to be easily associated with the module.
element.short: Logical identifier(s) for the module

element.definition: The version of the module, if any. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge modules, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that the version is required for non-experimental published artifact.
element.requirements: Allows for versioning of the content of the module.
element.short: The version of the module, if any

element.comments: This identifier for the module should be unique within the intended scope of use, and should conform to the traditional syntactic definition of an identifier within most programming languages. regex: ([A-Za-z_][A-Za-z0-9_]*).
element.definition: A machine-friendly name for the module. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.requirements: Simplifies machine-processing tasks related to the module such as code-generation or logging.
element.short: A machine-friendly name for the module

element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the module.
element.short: A user-friendly title for the module

binding.description: The type of knowledge module being described

element.definition: Identifies the type of knowledge module, such as a rule, library, documentation template, or measure.
element.short: module | library | decision-support-rule | documentation-template | order-set

binding.description: The status of the knowledge module

element.definition: The status of the module.
element.requirements: Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content of the module.
element.short: draft | active | inactive

element.definition: Determines whether the module was developed for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used in production environments.
element.requirements: Enables experimental content to be developed following the same life-cycle as a production-level module would.
element.short: If for testing purposes, not real usage

element.comments: This description can be used to capture details such as why the module was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the module as conveyed in the text field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the module from the consumer's perspective.
element.short: Natural language description of the module

element.comments: This description should address the question of why this module was built, though not necessarily in as much detail as the justification, rationale, or clinical recommendation statement of a measure would. That information would typically be provided in the related resource element.
element.definition: A brief description of the purpose of the module.
element.short: Describes the purpose of the module

element.definition: A detailed description of how the module is used from a clinical perspective.
element.short: Describes the clinical usage of the module

element.definition: The date on which the module was published.
element.short: Publication date for this version of the module

element.definition: The date on which the module content was last reviewed.
element.short: Last review date for the module

element.comments: The effective period for a module determines when the content is applicable for usage and is independent of publication and review dates. For example, a measure intended to be used for the year 2016 would be published in 2015.
element.definition: The period during which the module content is effective.
element.short: The effective date range for the module

element.definition: Specifies various attributes of the patient population for whom and/or environment of care in which, the knowledge module is applicable.
element.requirements: Consumers of the module must be able to determine the intended applicability for the module. Ideally, this information would be used programmatically to determine when and how it should be incorporated or exposed.
element.short: Describes the context of use for this module

binding.description: Specifies clinical metadata that can be used to retrieve, index and/or categorize the knowledge artifact. This metadata can either be specific to the applicable population (e.g., age category, DRG) or the specific context of care (e.g., venue, care setting, provider of care)

element.definition: Specifies the focus of the coverage attribute.
element.short: patient-gender | patient-age-group | clinical-focus | target-user | workflow-setting | workflow-task | clinical-venue | jurisdiction

element.definition: Provides a value for the coverage attribute. Different values are appropriate in different focus areas, as specified in the description of values for focus.
element.short: Value of the coverage attribute

element.definition: Clinical topics related to the content of the module.
element.requirements: Repositories must be able to determine how to categorize the module so that it can be found by topical searches.
element.short: Descriptional topics for the module

element.definition: A contributor to the content of the module, including authors, editors, reviewers, and endorsers.
element.requirements: Consumers of the content must be able to quickly determine who contributed to the content of the knowledge module.
element.short: A content contributor

element.definition: The type of contributor.
element.short: author | editor | reviewer | endorser

element.definition: The name of the individual or organization responsible for the contribution.
element.short: Name of the contributor

element.definition: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the contributor.
element.short: Contact details of the contributor

element.definition: The name of an individual to contact regarding the contribution.
element.short: Name of an individual to contact

element.definition: Contact details for the individual (if a name was provided) or the contributor.
element.short: Contact details for an individual or contributor

element.comments: The publisher (or steward) of the module is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the module. This is not necessarily the same organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the module.
element.definition: The name of the individual or organization that published the module (also known as the steward for the module). This information is required for non-experimental published artifacts.
element.requirements: Consumers of the module must be able to determine where to obtain support in the use of this module, as well as where to direct questions and concerns about the content.
element.short: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)

element.definition: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.short: Contact details of the publisher

element.definition: The name of an individual to contact regarding the module.
element.short: Name of an individual to contact

element.definition: Contact details for the individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.
element.short: Contact details for an individual or publisher

element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the module and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the module.
element.requirements: Consumers of the module must be able to determine any legal restrictions on the use of the module and/or its content.
element.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions

element.comments: Each related resource is either an attachment, or a reference to another resource, but not both.
element.definition: Related resources such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
element.requirements: Modules must be able to provide enough information for consumers of the content (and/or interventions or results produced by the content) to be able to determine and understand the justification for and evidence in support of the content.
element.short: Related resources for the module

binding.description: The type of related resource for the module

element.definition: The type of related resource.
element.short: documentation | justification | citation | predecessor | successor | derived-from

element.definition: The document being referenced, represented as an attachment. This is exclusive with the resource element.
element.short: The related document

element.comments: If the type is predecessor, this is a reference to the succeeding module. If the type is successor, this is a reference to the prior module.
element.definition: The related resource, such as a library, value set, profile, or other module.
element.short: The related resource

name: ModuleMetadata
requirements: Captures primary requirements for representing relevant metadata associated with a knowledge module, regardless of the type of module or content it contains.

element.definition: The ModuleMetadata structure defines the common metadata elements used by quality improvement artifacts. This information includes descriptive and topical metadata to enable repository searches, as well as governance and evidentiary support information.

element.short: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
ModuleMetadata ElementDefines common metadata used by quality artifacts
url Σ0..1uriLogical URL to reference this module
identifier Σ0..*IdentifierLogical identifier(s) for the module
version Σ0..1stringThe version of the module, if any
name Σ0..1stringA machine-friendly name for the module
title Σ0..1stringA user-friendly title for the module
type ?! Σ1..1codemodule | library | decision-support-rule | documentation-template | order-set
ModuleMetadataType (Extensible)
status ?! Σ1..1codedraft | active | inactive
ModuleMetadataStatus (Required)
experimental ?! Σ0..1booleanIf for testing purposes, not real usage
description 0..1stringNatural language description of the module
purpose 0..1stringDescribes the purpose of the module
usage 0..1stringDescribes the clinical usage of the module
publicationDate 0..1datePublication date for this version of the module
lastReviewDate 0..1dateLast review date for the module
effectivePeriod 0..1PeriodThe effective date range for the module
coverage 0..*ElementDescribes the context of use for this module
focus 1..1Codingpatient-gender | patient-age-group | clinical-focus | target-user | workflow-setting | workflow-task | clinical-venue | jurisdiction
ModuleMetadataFocusType (Extensible)
value 1..1CodeableConceptValue of the coverage attribute
topic 0..*CodeableConceptDescriptional topics for the module
contributor 0..*ElementA content contributor
type 1..1codeauthor | editor | reviewer | endorser
ModuleMetadataContributorType (Required)
name 1..1stringName of the contributor
contact 0..*ElementContact details of the contributor
name 0..1stringName of an individual to contact
telecom 0..*ContactPointContact details for an individual or contributor
publisher 0..1stringName of the publisher (Organization or individual)
contact 0..*ElementContact details of the publisher
name 0..1stringName of an individual to contact
telecom 0..*ContactPointContact details for an individual or publisher
copyright 0..1stringUse and/or publishing restrictions
relatedResource 0..*ElementRelated resources for the module
type 1..1codedocumentation | justification | citation | predecessor | successor | derived-from
ModuleMetadataResourceType (Required)
document 0..1AttachmentThe related document
resource 0..1Reference(Any)The related resource
